intro: Lysipomia obliqua, commonly known as the oblique lysipomia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Lysipomia obliqua is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat.
